abstract: Charter schools in New York City get option to hire more uncertified teachers after State Senate adds two provisions to bill allowing Mayor Bill de Blasio another year of control over city's schools; provision's language is broad, but would allow charters to waive requirements that limit number of uncertified teachers they can hire.

headline.print_headline: Late Deal in Albany Could Allow Charter Schools to Hire More Uncertified Teachers
headline.main: Late Deal in Albany Could Allow Charter Schools to Hire More Uncertified Teachers

snippet: Republicans demanded two provisions on charter schools in return for giving Mayor Bill de Blasio control of New York City schools for one more year.
lead_paragraph: Republicans demanded two provisions on charter schools in return for giving Mayor Bill de Blasio control of New York City schools for one more year.
